text: Train 4416, a "green train" operated by the Beijing Railway Bureau The terms green-skinned train and green train () refer to a type of design which used to be the mainstay of the passenger railway fleets of China and other communist countries during the Cold War. These words carry connotations of slow travel on old vehicles with few amenities, most notably lacking air conditioning. Despite these connotations, some newer trains have been painted green for nostalgic purposes. ==Gallery== ===China=== ====Original==== ====Modern==== ===Other countries=== File:Вагон_пассажирский_цельнометаллический_плацкартный_(1).jpg|First generation green train in the USSR from 1953 File:Bf_Engelsdorf,_Weitstreckenwagenrohbau.jpg|Later Soviet green train File:Shinwiju-pyongyang train.jpg|Korean State Railway green train File:TN17_Car_8_at_Dieu_Tri.JPG|Vietnam Railways green train File:Trans- Mongolian_Train.jpg|Mongolian green train File:Sk_in_Lublin.jpg|Polish State Railways green train File:Fotothek_df_n-10_0000144.jpg|East German green train File:Vůz_Aa,_Beroun.jpg|Czechoslovak State Railways green train ==References== Category:Rail transport in China
